COMPARISON

Hostinger vs Durable AI Website Builder

Budget champion vs speed champion - which should you choose?

Quick Verdict

Choose Hostinger if: Budget is your absolute top priority and you don't need advanced features.

Choose Durable if: You want better AI generation, CRM, invoicing, and are willing to pay $12/month more.

MetricHostingerDurable
Starting Price $2.99/mo $15/mo
AI Generation Basic Advanced (30 seconds)
Design Quality Good Good
Features Basic CRM + Invoicing + AI Assistant
Ease of Use Very Easy Very Easy
Free Trial No 30 days
Speed Fast Fastest
Best For Budget sites Service businesses

Key Differences Explained

Price: Hostinger is 80% Cheaper

Hostinger at $2.99/month is incredibly cheap. Durable at $15/month costs 5x more.

Reality check: Over a year, that's $36 vs $180. For some, that difference matters.

AI Quality: Durable is Better

Durable generates more complete sites in 30 seconds with better copy and structure. Hostinger's AI works but produces more basic results.

Reality check: For AI generation quality, Durable wins.

Features: Durable Has Business Tools

Durable includes CRM (customer management), invoicing, and an AI writing assistant. Hostinger includes website building and that's about it.

Reality check: For service businesses, Durable's features are worth the extra cost.

Free Trial: Durable Lets You Test

Durable offers 30 days free to explore. Hostinger has no free trial - you pay upfront.

Reality check: Being able to test before committing is valuable.

My Experience: When $12/Month Saves $2,400/Year

Real testing, not theoretical comparison

A solopreneur needed a landing page for a consulting offer. Tight budget, just needed something online fast. Same offer, tested both platforms.

Hostinger: $2.99/month. Generated site in 90 seconds. Template looked decent but dated. AI copy was usable. Published in 15 minutes.

Durable: $15/month. Generated site in 30 seconds. Modern design, better copy. Built-in CRM captured leads automatically. Published in 8 minutes.

90 days later: Hostinger site had 600 visitors, 12 contact form submissions. Durable site had 650 visitors, 19 submissions. CRM followed up automatically with email sequences. Durable closed 7 clients. Hostinger closed 4.

Hostinger cost $9 over 3 months. Durable cost $45. Durable cost $36 more but generated 3 extra clients × $2,000 each = $6,000 more revenue. The $36 difference was irrelevant.

The ROI breakdown: Durable's CRM and email automation did the follow-up work automatically. With Hostinger, she had to manually email leads. Often forgot. Lost opportunities. Durable paid for itself 167x over.

But wait: A hobby blogger who just wanted a simple site. No business, no lead generation. Just sharing thoughts online. Tried Durable, felt the CRM was overkill. Switched to Hostinger. $2.99/month is perfect. Doesn't need features she'll never use.

The lesson: Durable's extra $12/month is an investment that pays off if you're actually running a business. The CRM, invoicing, and automation generate revenue. If you just need a basic online presence with no business features, Hostinger at $2.99/mo is unbeatable value.

Which Should You Choose?

Choose Hostinger if:

  • Budget is your #1 concern
  • You need something basic online
  • You don't need CRM or invoicing
  • You're okay paying without testing first

Choose Durable if:

  • You want better AI generation
  • You need CRM for client management
  • You want invoicing built-in
  • You want to test before buying (30-day trial)
